website_summaries.verdict: If you want to run all your favorite games at impressively high FPS, this is the PC for you.
pros: The addition of bright blue lights on the sides and the logo of the case is beautiful, especially at night
We love having the option to upgrade from an air cooler to a liquid cooler
Arguably most impressive is how effortlessly this PC runs most modern games
Battlefield 4 on Ultra settings runs at around 200 FPS
There are 16GB of RAM, and an impressive graphics card (GTX 1070)
cons: The fan can get quite loud, especially during strenuous tasks

website_summaries.verdict: A workhorse that can keep up with passionate gamers and multimedia enthusiasts.
pros: 15 USB ports provide room for plenty of gaming devices
Incredibly powerful and doesn’t get hot even with prolonged gaming
cons: Factory-installed fan is loud with prolonged gaming, but a liquid cooler can be installed

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, blazing fast, should last for years, so far I consider it well worth the price. I have it hooked to my HDTV (via HDMI) and my monitor(DVI to HDMI) so I can work on it if I need to and play games with it hooked to my 55 inch tv. Been playing prey, graphics are great on both. I'm also a software developer, this handles Visual Studio development very easily. Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great price for performance on serious gaming machine!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, but will need new BIOS version and drivers for W10-1803 update of 4/30/2018. All are available from Dell, Intel, NVidia and MS. Cool features include six cores on the CPU that can turbo up to 4.6 GHz, but fan gets louder above 4 GHz. Very quiet during normal use. Great graphics for the price. This machine seemed to be the sweat spot for price for performance on higher performance machines.
customer_reviews.author: Watch collector 99

customer_reviews.title: Not a clean machine!
customer_reviews.text: Item case was scuffed and dusty, arrived in boxes already open. Clearly has been repackaged. After setup, won't let me activate Windows 10 because it says the "previous version" wasn't activated either!? So this isn't a clean Win10 install, but an upgrade from Win8? Might be a vendor issue, but this is very much not a plug-and-play machine! Now I have to spend how long to troubleshoot this? The hardware seems to run fine, and it is very quiet. Skyrim on Ultra runs great and looks amazing. Hoping I don't find any other surprises.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Everything I expected and more
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Everything I expected and more. Great for gaming. Only loud fan during heavy heavy downloading and only for a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Kimbler

customer_reviews.title: Waste of really big money
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a year. Now it won’t even boot. Worst part is Dell won’t even help. Don’t waste your time with this company
customer_reviews.author: Glogakosa

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine
customer_reviews.text: The startup time is exceptional and the video quality is great. Plus the SSD drive is super fast.
customer_reviews.author: SC Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Runs DOOM 2016 all day long while stream in to Twitch and YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: kelanth462

customer_reviews.title: Love Alienware, hate Dell
customer_reviews.text: The Alienware name has always been at the top for gaming. This machine is no different with one exception....Dell. Dell updates, which you cannot turn off or ignore, make this a 3 star computer. Don't get me wrong.... if you want to game, buy the machine. Just prepare yourself for the standard Dell BS, glitches, and constant BIOS updates (They can't get it right).
customer_reviews.author: Steve P.

customer_reviews.title: Beast. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Beast period. My first gaming pc and it has what I need and will allow me to grow and add to it as I need to. Great gaming pc. I also edit videos and it handles that with ease
customer_reviews.author: love!:)

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: Had it a week or so and it’s been great!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this computer. SSD is a solid extra bonus to boot speed.
customer_reviews.author: Tylor Slone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it run so somethly. But I don’t know what power supply it has.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Graphic card has 4 possible HDMI PORTS. The seller only allows for 1... removed the other 3 ports. Not VR ready... must buy adapters to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Alan Davis

customer_reviews.title: This computer ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Blazingly fast and amazingly beautiful computer. Excellent price. Just what the Doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hudspeth

customer_reviews.title: This computer was listed as Engineered to overclock: The ...
customer_reviews.text: This computer was listed as Engineered to overclock: The Alienware Aurora was designed to fully support custom upgrades with available 8th Gen Intel Core i7 8700 processors factory overclocked up to 4.6GHz across all 6 cores and 16GB of DDR4 at 2666MHz, 3.2 is all ya get. With gameing, My intel haswell Devils canyon could kick it ass! POS!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Nice job alienware
customer_reviews.text: Ok...right out of the box the killer e2500 network card was a POS...would kill the router. Needed a manual reinstall and to tone it down. Nice job alienware. And the problem is rampant. Ok so POS e2500 now works. PC is fast and so far works good. Vive takes a pile of updates and so does steam. Hard to get it all to work ...might be days before all the vr crap is downloaded. But the Alien miles better than MSI
customer_reviews.author: The Duke of Olinda

customer_reviews.title: start the desktop for first time, fan keeps going ...
customer_reviews.text: start the desktop for first time, fan keeps going making constant noise. not sure just this one all it happens to everyone
customer_reviews.author: SHAOHAN W.

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming
customer_reviews.text: This was a great experience. The computer really packs a punch for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jedidiah L Janisse

customer_reviews.title: I love Dell products
customer_reviews.text: This computer is a great running computer. I've been using it for a while now, and it is very fast and starts right up and goes right into the sign in mode, once you sign into the computer, you are up and running. It's very quiet and runs very smooth. Software is very easy to load on here, even with software that I've had problems with on other computers, loads right up on this one. The graphics and sound are great too. I have not had any problems with this computer yet, and I've been using it for at least 8 months now. It's quick and clean. It's quiet and stays cool as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. H.

customer_reviews.title: CPU and GPU fan are super loud
customer_reviews.text: For triple A games that can run good make the fans go really fast and its a bit scary. Its just super loud. But overall its a good pc but i would not recommend if fans being loud is a problem. It's a stock fan cooler and I wish the gpu fan wasn't that loud..
customer_reviews.author: Monica Canas-Pineda

customer_reviews.title: POS!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS POS! I paid top dollar for this and have had problems every single day. I asked Dell for assistance and they reconfigured the system so it would not work at all. I got it working, but every day there is a problem including nonrecognition of devices,will not start if game devices attached at start-up. The list goes on and on.
customer_reviews.author: James Stump

customer_reviews.title: I was really impressed with this computer. It was ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with this computer. It was really user friendly to get setup and started. It has a lot of power and speed and works amazingly well for graphics. It has a lot of advanced technology...probably more than I will ever use! High quality computer.
customer_reviews.author: LOL

product_meta.title: Dell AWAUR7-7883SLV-PUS Alienware Gaming PC Desktop Aurora R7 - 8th Gen Intel Core i7-8700, 16GB DDR4 Memory, 256GB SSD + 2TB Hard Drive, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070 8GB GDDR5, Windows 10 64-bit
product_meta.description: The new Alienware Aurora is a mid-tower desktop with a MicroATX Motherboard and is also our smallest dual-graphics capable desktop and has more tool-less features than any previous Alienware desktop such as: tool-less graphics, expansion cards, hard drives, and memory.
feature_bullets: Intel Core i7 8700 (6-Core/12-thread, 12MB Cache, up to 4.6GHz with Intel Turbo Boost Technology)
16GB 2666MHz DDR4 up to [64GB], Dual Channel (additional memory sold separately)
256GB [PCIe] (SSD) M.2 Boot + 2TB 7200 RPM SATA HDD 6GB/s storage, Tray-loading DVD Burner
With Windows 10, you'll experience fast start-ups, a familiar yet expanded Start menu, and great new ways to get stuff done.
